doc.title: EMBOSS

description.text: European Molecular Biology Open Software Suite

doc.reference: EMBOSS: The European Molecular Biology Open Software Suite (2000) Rice,P. Longden,I. and Bleasby, A. Trends in Genetics 16, (6) pp276--277

description.text: Display basic information about a multiple sequence alignment

fieldset.title: This parameter is mandatory
fieldset.data-formats: FASTA MSF PAIR MARKX0 MARKX1 MARKX2 MARKX3 MARKX10 SRS SRSPAIR SCORE UNKNOWN MULTIPLE SIMPLE MATCH

xhtml:div.xhtml:div: The sequence alignment to be displayed.

xhtml:div.label:
Similarity scoring matrix file?
Eblosum30 Eblosum35 Eblosum40 Eblosum45 Eblosum50 Eblosum55 Eblosum60 Eblosum62 Eblosum62-12 Eblosum65 Eblosum70 Eblosum75 Eblosum80 Eblosum85 Eblosum90 Eblosumn Ednafull Ednamat Ednasimple Epam10 Epam100 Epam110 Epam120 Epam130 Epam140 Epam150 Epam160 Epam170 Epam180 Epam190 Epam20 Epam200 Epam210 Epam220 Epam230 Epam240 Epam250 Epam260 Epam270 Epam280 Epam290 Epam30 Epam300 Epam310 Epam320 Epam330 Epam340 Epam350 Epam360 Epam370 Epam380 Epam390 Epam40 Epam400 Epam410 Epam420 Epam430 Epam440 Epam450 Epam460 Epam470 Epam480 Epam490 Epam50 Epam500 Epam60 Epam70 Epam80 Epam90 Sssub
This is the scoring matrix file used when comparing sequences. By default it is the file 'EBLOSUM62' (for proteins) or the file 'EDNAFULL' (for nucleic sequences). These files are found in the 'data' directory of the EMBOSS installation.

The number or the name of the reference sequence?
If you give the number in the alignment or the name of a sequence, it will be taken to be the reference sequence. The reference sequence is the one against which all the other sequences are compared. If this is set to 0 then the consensus sequence will be used as the reference sequence. By default the consensus sequence is used as the reference sequence.

Plurality check % for consensus (value from 0.0 to 100.0)?
Set a cut-off for the % of positive scoring matches below which there is no consensus. The default plurality is taken as 50% of the total weight of all the sequences in the alignment.

Required % of identities at a position fro consensus (value from 0.0 to 100.0)?
Provides the facility of setting the required number of identities at a position for it to give a consensus. Therefore, if this is set to 100% only columns of identities contribute to the consensus.

Name of the output file (e_outfile)?
If you enter the name of a file here then this program will write the sequence details into that file.
Format output as an html table Yes No

Display the specified columns?
Yes No
This is a way of shortening the command line if you only want a few things to be displayed. Instead of specifying: '-nohead -nousa -noname -noalign -nogaps -nogapcount -nosimcount -noidcount -nodiffcount -noweight' to get only the sequence length output, you can specify '-only -seqlength'
Display column headings Yes No
Display the usa of the sequence Yes No
Display 'name' column Yes No
Display 'seqlength' column Yes No
Display 'alignlength' column Yes No
Display number of gaps Yes No
Display number of gap positions Yes No
Display number of identical positions Yes No
Display number of similar positions Yes No
Display number of different positions Yes No
Display % number of changed positions Yes No
Display 'weight' column Yes No
Display 'description' column Yes No

div.title: This parameter is mandatory
div.data-formats: FASTA MSF PAIR MARKX0 MARKX1 MARKX2 MARKX3 MARKX10 SRS SRSPAIR SCORE UNKNOWN MULTIPLE SIMPLE MATCH

xhtml:div.xhtml:div: The sequence alignment to be displayed.

This is the scoring matrix file used when comparing sequences. By default it is the file 'EBLOSUM62' (for proteins) or the file 'EDNAFULL' (for nucleic sequences). These files are found in the 'data' directory of the EMBOSS installation.

If you give the number in the alignment or the name of a sequence, it will be taken to be the reference sequence. The reference sequence is the one against which all the other sequences are compared. If this is set to 0 then the consensus sequence will be used as the reference sequence. By default the consensus sequence is used as the reference sequence.
Set a cut-off for the % of positive scoring matches below which there is no consensus. The default plurality is taken as 50% of the total weight of all the sequences in the alignment.
Provides the facility of setting the required number of identities at a position for it to give a consensus. Therefore, if this is set to 100% only columns of identities contribute to the consensus.
If you enter the name of a file here then this program will write the sequence details into that file.

This is a way of shortening the command line if you only want a few things to be displayed. Instead of specifying: '-nohead -nousa -noname -noalign -nogaps -nogapcount -nosimcount -noidcount -nodiffcount -noweight' to get only the sequence length output, you can specify '-only -seqlength'

comment.text: The sequence alignment to be displayed.

parameter.name: e_refseq
parameter.prompt: The number or the name of the reference sequence

format.code: ("", " -refseq=" + str(value))[value is not None and value!=vdef]

comment.text: If you give the number in the alignment or the name of a sequence, it will be taken to be the reference sequence. The reference sequence is the one against which all the other sequences are compared. If this is set to 0 then the consensus sequence will be used as the reference sequence. By default the consensus sequence is used as the reference sequence.

interface.label:
The number or the name of the reference sequence?
If you give the number in the alignment or the name of a sequence, it will be taken to be the reference sequence. The reference sequence is the one against which all the other sequences are compared. If this is set to 0 then the consensus sequence will be used as the reference sequence. By default the consensus sequence is used as the reference sequence.

parameter.name: e_plurality
parameter.prompt: Plurality check % for consensus (value from 0.0 to 100.0)

format.code: ("", " -plurality=" + str(value))[value is not None and value!=vdef]

message.text: Value greater than or equal to 0.0 is required
Value less than or equal to 100.0 is required

comment.text: Set a cut-off for the % of positive scoring matches below which there is no consensus. The default plurality is taken as 50% of the total weight of all the sequences in the alignment.

Set a cut-off for the % of positive scoring matches below which there is no consensus. The default plurality is taken as 50% of the total weight of all the sequences in the alignment.

interface.label: Format output as an html table Yes No

comment.text: This is a way of shortening the command line if you only want a few things to be displayed. Instead of specifying: '-nohead -nousa -noname -noalign -nogaps -nogapcount -nosimcount -noidcount -nodiffcount -noweight' to get only the sequence length output, you can specify '-only -seqlength'
